message_1:
Suppose you have two propositions:
 
P: "It is sunny today."
Q: "I will go for a walk today."
 
Using propositional logic, create a truth table to show all possible combinations of P and Q, and the resulting truth values of the compound propositions "P and Q" and "P or Q."
message_2:
Here is the truth table for the given propositions P and Q, and the compound propositions "P and Q" and "P or Q":

| P     | Q     | P and Q | P or Q |
|-------|-------|---------|--------|
| True  | True  | True    | True   |
| True  | False | False   | True   |
| False | True  | False   | True   |
| False | False | False   | False  |

In this table, each row represents a possible combination of truth values for P and Q. The "P and Q" column shows the truth value of the compound proposition "P and Q" for each combination, and the "P or Q" column shows the truth value of the compound proposition "P or Q" for each combination.
